newsitem.title: USA: Quaker's Snapple to launch 100 pct juice line.
newsitem.headline: Quaker's Snapple to launch 100 pct juice line.

text.p: Quaker Oats Co. said Tuesday it plans to introduce a line of 100 percent juice drinks under its Snapple brand, adding to its existing offerings of fruit-flavored and iced tea beverages.

"We are planning on introducing some 100 percent juice products later this year," Quaker spokesman Ronald Bottrell said. "We'll be making an announcement as to the specific products and the number of products. But at this point, we're not in a position to provide details."
The Chicago Sun-Times reported Tuesday that Quaker will launch a four-flavor line to be called Snapple 100 percent Juice.
Bottrell declined to give specifics on the new juice line.
"We're a few weeks away from providing details to our distributors and to the public at large," he added. "You'll be hearing more from us on this."
The new juice product line comes at a time Quaker is trying to turn Snapple around. The business has posted an operating loss since it was acquired two years ago in a $1.8 billion transaction.

"Snapple clearly remains challenging," Quaker Chairman William Smithburg said in a letter to shareholders included in the 1996 annual report. "It is a large brand with over $500 million in sales and strong consumer appeal. But in 1996, it operated at a significant loss."
He added the goal is to run Snapple at a cash operating profit in 1997.
